title.narrative: POLICY AND BUDGETS FOR YOUNG CHILD

description.narrative: Ensuring enabling environment:National policies, legislation, strategies and plans with budgets adopted in line with international standards for modeling innovative approaches and scaling up of evidence based high impact health interventions in MCH, nutrition and Early Child Development (ECD). , which contributes to Child Health, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By end-2020, all children, including children with developmental difficulties, have access to quality health services to ensure child survival, health and better developmental outcomes.

SCIENTIFIC AND CLINICAL CENTER OF MOTHER AND CHILD HEALTH

sector.narrative: HSS - Health sector policy, planning and governance at national or sub-national levels

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Ensuring enabling environment:National policies, legislation, strategies and plans with budgets adopted in line with internationalstandards for modeling innovative approaches and scaling up of evidence based high impact health interventions in MCH, nutritionand ECD.

description.narrative: Despite of major challenges driven by COVID Pandemic, major progress has been achieved as a result of joint cooperation with the Ministry of Health and Medical Industry. Notably, with country’s efforts and UNICEF advocacy and procurement support the continuity of immunization programme has been ensured and a new joint 5-year Procurement Plan has been signed with the Government. A big step forward was achieved in ECD field with endorsement of the ECD policy document for the next 5 years, as well as approval of the National Nutrition programme for 2020-2025 for improving nutrition status of population. | Status:Met | As-of Date:26/01/2021

title.narrative: Integration of nutrition counselling in pregnancy care programmes

baseline.value: 2 out of the 4 suggested components are integrated into nutrition counselling of pregnancy care programmes, however, there is no clear evidence about their full implementation,

target.value: 2020:The antenatal care protocol is revised to include all four components on nutrition counseling.

actual.value: 2020:While it was not possible to conduct the rapid of the knowledge and practice of health workers and pregnant women on quality of nutrition counselling due to challenges with identifying an institution with pertinent qualifications, the Assessment of the MN

title.narrative: Availability of strong (independent, rigorous and participatory) evidence base for policymaking and programming in the area of nutrition of children and women(49093)

baseline.value: Data from the 2012 National Nutrition Study with a focus on anemia and vitamin A deficiency in Turkmenistan and standard nutrition data from the 2015-16 MICS exist, but there is no surveillance data

target.value: 2020:Standardization of anemia testing through the FORTIMAS in all FORTIMAS sentinel sites is improved with the introduction of HemoQue testing (in cooperation with UNFPA)

actual.value: 2020:The FORTIMAS system is functioning with data collected on anemia and urine. The standardization of the anemia labs test, as pointed out by the assessment of the quality of anemia tests from 12 sentinel sites. The HemoQue will be introduced (in cooperatio

title.narrative: Availability of a draft Ministerial decree for ensuring quality of the new-born and child health care (ENAP activation)(52727)

baseline.value: No quality assurance policy in place

target.value: 2020:Staff of all the 13 maternities at the third level (18% of the total) know how to apply the standards on provision of quality and effective care to mothers and newbornsQuality assurance policy is in place.

actual.value: 2020:Training of 38 trainers continued to enable supportive supervision to ensure quality assurance programme effectiveness. Training of all staff of maternity facilities were postponed due to COVID restrictions.

title.narrative: Adoption of the International Code on Marketing of Breastmilk substitutes as legislation and subsequent relevant World Health Assembly resolutions

baseline.value: Partial adoption through the National Law on Breastfeeding

target.value: 2020:Score 5. The full provision in Law. The Technical Group completes ICMBS monitoring in 3 velayts and BFHI re-certification of 92% of the 3rd level maternities. while the certification of PHC facilities in all regions continue.

actual.value: 2020:Score 5: Full provision in law. The BFHI certification was conducted by the Technical Working Group in three regions of the country. 20 facilities were part of the monitoring. 8 maternity hospitals were successfully recertified and passed certification fo

title.narrative: Implementation of a national strategy to prevent stunting in children

baseline.value: Score 1: The previous nutrition programme for 2013-2017 came to an end. There is no national strategy that includes prevention or reduction of stunting in children under five years of age, or strategy is in draft.

target.value: 2020:Score 4: A national strategy that includes prevention or reduction of stunting in children under five years of age is approved by the Government. Evidence-based nutrition-specific services are provided at scale at the national or sub-national level. Flour

actual.value: 2020: A National Programme on Healthy Nutrition for population for 2020-2025 endorsed. Flour Fortification formula revisited. A guideline on new formula presented for government consideration.

title.narrative: Costed implementation plan for maternal, newborn and child health care available

baseline.value: Score 2. The national MNCAH Strategy and Action Plan for 2015-2019 meets 2 criteria out of 4 10 Disparity Analysis and 2) Bottleneck analysis

target.value: 2020:Score 2. UNICEF provides technical support for the finalization and adoption of the national MNCAH Strategy for 2020-2030 and its five-year action plan, meeting the following three criteria out of 4, fully or partially: 1) Disparity Analysis 2) Bottleneck

actual.value: 2020:Score 2. The national MNCAH Strategy, which meets only 2 criteria out of 4, was assessed. The findings and recommendation are used to draft a new RMNCAH Strategy for 2020-2030, with the process of consultations continuing.
